alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 2:07PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NASSAU...CENTRAL BAKER...SOUTHEASTERN WARE AND CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EST... At 207 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Stephen Foster State Park to 16 miles northwest of St. George to 7 miles southwest of Taylor. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hilliard, Folkston, Stephen Foster State Park, Homeland, Kings Ferry, St. George, Race Pond, and Winokur. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Jacksonville. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
